item.title: Wheel Brakes – Deactivated by Special Brake Tool (Preferred Method) (Not to be Used for a Leaking Brake)

remarks.para: One brake may be deactivated with a deactivation tool provided:

numlitem.para: Performance complies with AOM for one brake deactivated,
Anti-skid is operative on remaining wheels, and
Flaps 1 and Flaps 5 takeoff not authorized.

note.para: Dispatch is not allowed with a brake deactivated and the anti-skid system inoperative.

operation.para: (Use appropriate One Brake Deactivated worksheet respective to engine type, in Chapter 5.1 of the AOM.)

numlitem.para: Use max takeoff thrust.
See the destination airport landing chart for the runway limit weight for landing with one wheel brake deactivated.

note.para: Reduce the Quick Turn Around Limit Weight for Landing (corrected for wind and runway slope) by 14,500 lbs. (PW) and 14,900 lbs. (RR). If corrected maximum Quick Turn Around Limit Weight is exceeded, wait at least 45 minutes and check that the wheel thermal plugs have not melted before executing a takeoff.

numlitem.para: Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: Must be operative for dispatch into LPB, UIO, BOG, GUA, TGU.

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff Weight Reductions:
Runway Limit Weight reduced by 9,000 lbs. for Flaps 15 or Flaps 20.
Landing Weight Reduction – see destination airport landing chart for Max Landing Weight With One Brake Deactivated.
Flaps 1 and Flaps 5 takeoff operation is not allowed.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

placard.para: Placard Auto Brakes Control Panel “ONE BRAKE DEACTIVATED” and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Wheel Brakes – Deactivated by Special Brake Tool (Preferred Method)

numlitem.para: Use MEL 32-41-1-2 if brake inoperative due to fluid leak.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Notify Flight Dispatch that preferred method is being utilized.
Retrieve special brake dispatch disconnect tool located in the flight dispatch kit in the EE bay.
Check that wheels are adequately chocked.

warning.para: DOOR LOCKS MUST BE PROPERLY INSTALLED PRIOR TO ACCESS TO ANTI-SKID SHUTTLE VALVE MODULE (REF. MAINTENANCE MANUAL 32-00-15). RAPID ACTION OF DOORS MAY INJURE PERSONNEL OR DAMAGE EQUIPMENT IF LOCKS ARE NOT PROPERLY INSTALLED.

numlitem.para: Open main gear doors and Install main gear door locks.
Depressurize right and left hydraulic systems (including reservoirs).
Release parking brakes by depressing both brake pedals fully and releasing. Check that PARK BRAKE light on P10 panel extinguishes.

note.para: Parking brakes may be released by operating either the Captain's or First Officer's brake pedals.

numlitem.para: Discharge hydraulic pressure from parking brake accumulator by use of either the Captain's or First Officer's brake pedals. Fully depress and release both pedals at the same time, seven times minimum, until the cockpit brake pressure gauge indication no longer decreases.
Gain access to anti-skid shuttle valve module located in the left or right main gear wheel outboard bulkhead (see following illustrations).

caution.para: REMOVE ONLY THE SHUTTLE VALVE SLIDE PLUG. REMOVAL OF THE SHUTTLE VALVE CAN RESULT IN INJURY DUE TO RAPID EJECTION OF THE VALVE.

numlitem.para: Remove appropriate anti-skid shuttle valve slide plug only from module. Stow slide plug in pouch behind F/O's seat.
Install special brake dispatch disconnect tool in place of removed shuttle valve slide plug.
Gain access to the anti-skid/autobrake control unit on the E5 equipment rack.
Position Brake Test/Disable selector to the brake which was deactivated.
Test proper deactivation of wheel brake by pressurizing right hydraulic system.

Depress and release either Captain's or First Officer's brake pedals several times. Check that brake wear indicator pins (or pistons and adjustors) on deactivated brake do not move or change position, while movement is observed for all other brakes.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration. Leave the Anti-skid/Autobrake Control Unit Selector in the disabled brake position for dispatch.
